comment: Mastering every week, labs every other week, lab quizzes every three or four weeks, and tests every two weeks. All she does is read off of PowerPoints, which she puts on d2l. Test are based on application of the principles but all she does is read you definitions so tests are challenging. Science is a gen ed course and she makes it VERY hard.

As long as you came to class you knew what was going to be on the test because she told you outright what you needed to know. Gave many opportunities to earn extra credit/bonus points. All you need to do is pay attention in class and read/skim the book. Stay on top of the online assignments and lab quizzes and it's an extremely easy class to pass.

I highly discourage taking this class. Highly effective for curing insomnia, however. Many times, the tests were on material that wasn't scheduled. Lectures are useless, as I am capable of reading the slides myself. If this class is your last resort, may the odds be ever in your favour.

This woman is the most god-awful professor I have ever taken. Her tests come from no where. She doesn't lecture because she reads the powerpoints word for word. The homework is easy and the lab quizzes are ridiculous. Her class is the hardest I have ever taken and she doesn't really care if you fail or not. Really hard to pass this class. AVOID!

Atrocious professor; it saddened me that she was a nice person. Unless you memorize the textbook you'll probably bomb the tests, which are vastly different than what she teaches in class (reading off powerpoint central!). Avoid taking her and if you can't help it, godspeed.
Study becasue she wont help you. Attendance is not mandatory. grading scale is set in stone and wont budge, so you get what you get

Tests are tricky on the way she words questions. A large majority of my class failed the class. Mastering is easy and the labs are straight forward and online. She does read straight off the power point. 3 tests and an optional final. Study guides aren't that helpful, and asks for detailed things about a broad topic. Not an easy A course!

Although Professor Hoban is not very helpful, the class is really easy. I rarely went to class. I just read the chapters, studied the powerpoints, and showed up to tests. Mastering is easy, and lab quizzes come straight from  the labs. Easy A if you do the work and study appropriately. I don't know why people are saying its so hard.

The class itself is super easy. I never attended class--I just read the chapters carefully and studied the powerpoints and showed up for tests. Easy A. Mastering is straight from the book and lab quizzes are straight from the labs. She is not helpful at all, but you can still ace the course without her help.

HORRIBLE COURSE. Do not take this class w/ Hoban if you want to make an A. There is so much busy work that helps in no way for tests. She is so boring in class, reads straight from power points. No point in going to class, attendence isnt mandatory. She started off the semester by announcing that her class was the most failed at KSU. DONT TAKE HER!

I took Science 1101 and she was so unclear about what she wanted. Her powerpoints are worthless. She does not make herself available for any help. I earned my only B in this class, but I was proud of it. Most people got D's or F's.

Environmental Science class. Teaches directly from her lecture slides. Tests come straight from the lecture slides. Don't need to read the book, but do need it for mastering. DO NOT FORGE YOUR MASTERING EACH WEEK! Lab quizzes are easy. Tests are fair. Study the notes, do your labs, do your mastering, attend for group assignments and you will pass!
